author: parithosh
content:
Our options are:
- Continue holesky as is, make deposits once we achieve finality again (con: we won't have mainnet conditions for a while)
- Continue holesky as is for non-finality testing/delete when done, setup a holesky shadowfork with a new validator set (same entities we know, new validator keys) (con: co-ordination and messy)(pro: contracts and state continues to be useful)
- Continue holesky as is for non-finality testing/delete when done, setup a fresh network for people to move validator testing to (con: needs everyone to deploy contracts/tooling)(pro: less messy)

in all situations we continue holesky as is until we learn all that we can from it. the question is how we solve the issue of validators getting to test their setups.
